meanings.definition: The premature ignition of fuel in an internal combustion engine before the spark plug fires.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic diagnosed the problem as preignition in the engine.
meanings.sent2: Preignition can cause serious damage to the vehicle's components.
meanings.sent3: The car seemed to have a mind of its own, experiencing preignition at the most inconvenient times.
meanings.sent4: The preignition of ideas in his mind led to a burst of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The image of preignition in the engine was like a tiny firecracker going off unexpectedly.

meanings.definition: The act or process of igniting prematurely before the intended time.
meanings.sent1: The preignition of the fireworks startled the audience.
meanings.sent2: The preignition of the rocket launch caused a delay in the mission.
meanings.sent3: The preignition of the birthday candles made the cake look like a sparkly mess.
meanings.sent4: His speech had a preignition of excitement that captivated the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The preignition of the campfire lit up the night sky with a sudden burst of light.
